intro: Coespeletia lutescens, commonly known as the yellow coespeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in dense inflorescences. Coespeletia lutescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems.
